newsitem.title: UK: Williams Holdings buys Spain's Tesa. [CORRECTED 09:20 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Williams Holdings buys Spain's Tesa. [CORRECTED 09:20 GMT]

text.p: British fire protection and building products manufacturer Williams Holdings Plc said on Friday it bought Tesa, a Spanish commercial and residential security products maker, for 101 million pounds.
Williams said it was buying Tesa from Tesa's majority family owners and Newman Tonks Group Plc.
Tesa expects profit before interest and tax of around $19 million and sales of $153 million in the year to December 31, 1996. (Corrects figures and currency).

Williams said the move would strengthen its security products division. It called Tesa the market leader in Spain for commercial and residential security and "number two in the world electronic hotel lock market."
Williams said Tesa's executive directors would remain with the business after the acquisition was completed.
